node.title: Costello says RBA 'irresponsible' on rates, but who is responsible for housing affordability?
node.alt: A man wearing a suit and tie.
node.description: Australia's skyrocketing property market has seen house prices increase 22 per cent in 12 months. As Alan Kohler writes, there's no easy answer to housing affordability.
node.content:
["Former Treasurer Peter Costello has labelled the Reserve Bank of Australia \"irresponsible\" for stating it would keep interest rates where they are until 2024.", "While the RBA has now dropped that wording, the central bank is saying it is \"plausible\" that rates will stay where they are until 2024.", "\"It was an irresponsible statement to make that they could hold that rate until 2024,\" Mr Costello told ABC's 7.30.", "\"I suppose they were saying to people, 'Try and get a fixed mortgage because we can hold the rates out to 2024.'", "\"They now admit they can't hold that rate at 0.1 per cent to 2024, and in fact, it will be irresponsible of them to try if inflation took off.\"", "The RBA declined to comment.\u00a0", "Mr Costello made the comments on 7.30 in an interview on Australia's skyrocketing property market, a boom that has seen house prices increase 22 per cent in 12 months.", "", "
The RBA was \"irresponsible\" to say it could hold interest rates until 2024, Peter Costello says.(AAP: Joel Carrett)
", "\"I think the Reserve Bank should worry.\u00a0I think the prudential regulators should worry.\u00a0I think the government should worry.\u00a0I think all policy makers should worry,\" Mr Costello\u00a0said.\u00a0", "Australia's 10.7 million homes are now worth $9.3 trillion dollars \u2014\u00a0or an average of $869,000 each \u2014 and that's an increase of $1\u00a0trillion in just six months.", "
Debate over capital gains tax
", "However, for his part, Mr Costello defended his decision in 1999 to introduce a 50 per cent discount to capital gains tax, which many analysts believe is also partly responsible for the housing affordability crisis.", "In its submission to an ongoing Parliamentary inquiry into housing affordability, the NSW Government singled out the tax\u00a0\u2014\u00a0which provides a major tax break for those selling properties they have owned for 12 months or more \u2014\u00a0as being a part of the housing affordability problem.\u00a0", "\"These tax benefits of property investment have contributed to the growing housing affordability issue,\" the NSW Government said in its submission.\u00a0", "\"While the combined effect is likely to be a moderate increase in house prices, the most significant impact is the displacement of owner-occupiers \u2014 including first home buyers \u2014\u00a0from home ownership by tax-advantaged investors, predominantly those already on higher incomes.", "\"The federal government should review taxation settings, including the capital gains tax discount of 50 per cent on properties held for over 12 months, and consider reforms to ensure an appropriate balance between the purchases of properties for owner-occupied and investment reasons.\"", "However, Mr Costello pointed out that, when home ownership was at its highest in Australia \u00a0during the late 60s, the capital gains tax rate was zero.", "\"This idea that somehow house prices went up because of the capital gains tax discount just flies in the face of all evidence,\" Mr Costello said.", "\"Every country in the world, by the way, has a lower capital gains tax than their income tax. In fact, the differential between the two in Australia is lower than it is in most other countries.\"", "", "
Jason Falinski says something needs to be done about housing affordability.(ABC News: Matt Roberts)
", "However, the chairman of the committee conducting the housing affordability inquiry, Liberal MP Jason Falinski, said that capital gains tax was \"an issue that should be looked at\".", "\"I think that will be part of the report,\" he said.", "Mr Falinski also said\u00a0that having some of the least-affordable housing in the world in Australia was akin to \"intergenerational theft\".", "I asked him whether he thought this was deliberate.", "\"Yes, I do think that there has been active consideration by different levels of government and different professions that have determined that they had an opportunity to lower the cost of housing\u00a0but, instead, were disinclined to do this, or dis-incentivised to do it, because it benefited them to have higher prices in housing,\" Mr Falinski\u00a0said.", "
Keeping house prices high
", "", "
Simon Kuestenmacher says politicians are not game to tackle the issue of housing affordability.(Supplied: Locate19)
", "There seems to be an inherit hesitation by governments over the decades to really address the problem through major structural reform \u2014\u00a0including tax reform \u2014\u00a0rather opting for\u00a0\"band-aid\" fixes.\u00a0", "Demographer Simon Kuestenmacher put it more succinctly.", "\"If you touch house prices, if you introduce any kind of policy that could make house prices fall, you will lose any election,\" he noted.", "\"Politicians shed crocodile tears about it and say, 'It's so sad that house prices are so expensive. We'll give you $10,000 of first home buyers grants'.", "\"But these drive house prices up because everybody has more money.", "\"It's a silly game when people pretend that they care.\"", "Mr Costello agreed governments were reluctant to interfere with the housing market, because it could come at a financial cost for home owners.\u00a0", "\"If you own a house, and you're established in a house, you don't want to lower the price for your house,\" Mr Costello told 7.30.", "\"Nobody wants to go to an auction and sell their house and get a lower price.\u00a0", "\"So, you are right that there are many incentives for governments to keep the prices high, just as there are incentives for established home owners to keep the prices high.", "\"That's why I talk about the fact that this is particularly a first-time buyer's problem.\"", "You only need to look at Labor's ill-fated negative gearing policy, which former party leader Bill Shorten took to two elections and lost \u2014\u00a0and that the current leader,\u00a0Anthony Albanese, has now dropped ahead of the upcoming federal election\u00a0\u2014\u00a0to see it's a policy area fraught with dangers.\u00a0", "
A complex problem
", "", "
Decentralisation could help to take pressure of house prices,\u00a0Simon Kuestenmacher says(ABC News: John Gunn)
", "Mr Kuestenmacher said part of the solution to housing affordability was decentralisation, except that governments have been unwilling to spend on the infrastructure required.", "\"Two thirds of the country live in just five cities. There's no other country on Earth where the population is so very concentrated. So, therefore, it makes sense to amp-up the population in our secondary cities and our regional hubs,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"In order to drive decentralisation, you need to improve infrastructure, you need to make sure that the individual cities are connected with really good roads, with high-speed rail networks.", "\"And you want to make sure that the cities that you push population into aren't too far away.\"", "However, if we learnt anything about housing while preparing this piece for 7.30 it was that there is no single, easy answer to housing affordability: It's a complex problem with many parts.", "", "
Professor Emma Baker says there is \"no plan for housing in Australia\".(ABC News)
", "Professor Emma Baker, housing researcher at the University of Adelaide, said\u00a0that the housing affordability crisis was \"actually a crisis of our own making\".\u00a0", "\"I think we can put that down to the fact that we have no plan for housing in Australia,\" she said.", "\"We don't deal with housing as a system. We respond in piecemeal ways.", "\"For example, the HomeBuilder intervention\u00a0was effectively just pumping demand into the market at just the wrong time.\"", "In fact, every economist we spoke to said that schemes like the HomeBuilder grant and first home buyers' grants only make matters worse, by increasing demand and driving prices even higher.", "I put this contradiction to Jason Falinski\u00a0and asked him whether these types of programs benefit the sellers by pushing up prices, rather than buyers. The issue seems to be on his radar.\u00a0", "\"There has been policy settings put in to the Australian economy that didn't have the objective or the aim of keeping housing affordable in the Australian context,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"We have systems in place that continue to incentivise and reward higher prices in the housing market.", "\"I can't pre-empt what the [housing affordability inquiry] report is going to have in it, but I'd be very surprised if there isn't a paragraph or two, or even a recommendation, around the impacts of stimulating demand \u2014\u00a0whether it be for a particular group of people or not \u2014\u00a0on house prices overall.\"", "However,\u00a0giving these cash handouts to wannabe home owners is a lot sexier in an election campaign than reforms to negative gearing or capital gains tax, and is easier for political parties to sell to voters.", "Nonetheless, Mr Falinski seems determined to find\u00a0a more long-term fix.\u00a0", "\"Honestly, you're talking to one politician who thinks that this is in a top three or four questions that we face in this country right now,\" Mr Falinski said.", "\"This is something we need to do something about, and I don't I don't see that there is anything stopping us from doing anything about it.", "\"I think the report \u2026\u00a0will take very heavy note of the fact that the current tax system \u2014\u00a0at the federal, state and local government level, but particularly for\u00a0state and local governments \u2014\u00a0actually incentivises those levels of government to have higher prices when it comes to housing.\"", "
Making renting more long-term
", "", "
Making renting more attractive could help with housing affordability,\u00a0Professor Emma Baker says.(ABC News)
", "It keeps coming back to the fact that there is no one answer to housing affordability: The supply of houses needs to be increased through better zoning, more encouragement for greenfield development and decentralisation, and demand needs to be dampened by removing tax breaks and government grants for buyers.", "Also, it would\u00a0help if conditions were better for tenants so that families were willing to keep renting rather than wanting to buy, by lengthening lease terms, allowing pets and generally tilting the playing field in favour of tenants.\u00a0", "\"At the moment we have a rental sector where it's designed as a transition tenure, on the assumption that people eventually make it into home ownership,\" Professor Baker said.", "\"So why not look at the rental sector and say, 'How can we make this the kind of tenure that you want to live in for your whole life?'\u00a0Let's increase the average lease length from 12 months and put some minimum standards in. Let's make the rental sector feel like a place that you can live\".", "Above all, perhaps, let's make someone take responsibility for housing affordability.", "The banking regulator, APRA\u00a0and the Reserve Bank have told the Falinski inquiry it's not their responsibility.", "But there are also nine housing ministers in Australia. What are they doing?", "Watch this story on 7.30 on iview.", "Alan Kohler is finance presenter on ABC News. He also writes twice a week for The New Daily and is editor-in-chief of Eureka Report."]
